Title: "I am studying so hard for AI / ML interview, but can't crack it" - if you are too in the same zone, come out of traditional preparation loop. | Manish Mazumder | 33 comments

Description: "I am studying so hard for AI / ML interview, but can't crack it" - if you are too in the same zone, come out of traditional preparation loop. Here's what you actually need to crack AI / ML / GenAI interviews in 2025:

✅ 1. Solve Coding Problems - every single day
Most people get rejected here without moving further. Companies will ask one DSA for sure:
- Arrays, Strings, Hashmaps
- Sliding window, Binary Search, Two pointers
- Matrix traversal, Graphs, DP (optional but good to have)

Study material: LeetCode 150 / Striver's DSA sheet / GFG SDE sheet
Set a target: 2 DSA questions/day = 60/month = a real confidence booster!

✅ 2. Build Projects That Teach You and Impress Recruiters
Skip toy datasets and MNIST clones. Instead, build real-world GenAI and ML projects like:
- A Resume Screening Bot using LLMs
- Fake News Detector from live RSS feeds
- Multi-label Tag Predictor for articles / e-commerce products
- Semantic Search App using Vector DBs

Build → Deploy → Document → Share (Linkedin / Reddit / X)
That’s the cycle, make sure you know end-to-end of a project.

✅ 3. Master ML System Design — It’s Asked in Every Interview Now
This is a reminder that System Design is non-negotiable. Some case studies include:
- Design a system that summarizes customer support tickets in real time
- Walk me through how you'd deploy an LLM-based assistant.

Train yourself to:
- Break down problems into small components
- Identify edge cases, build evaluation metric
- Choose trade-offs (accuracy vs latency)
- Design for scale and data drift

Tip: Maintain a personal repo of 10+ system design case studies with diagrams.

If you maintain this healthy study routine for 2-3 months rigorously, you will be 100% ready for interview with confidence.
______
